page.title: 03FARMING 1.
page.content: Local farming is of a mixed type based on relatively small family farms as opposed to some of the vast, intensive cereal production that one now sees in parts of the Midlands. By "family farms" we mean those of approx.200/500 acres,farmed by the tenant/owner. Land formerly owned by the N.C.B. is being sold to the sitting tenants thus the number of owners has increased without interference from large scale business interests. Reasons for this type of farming are to be found in the nature of the land; undulating, with soil that can vary considerably in quality (see geology) Mixed with fertile areas are enclaves of heavy glacial drift. Add these to_ gether and it can be seen that only a portion of the land is suitable for efficient mechanized farming.
